verses.verse: Day and night they go around it on its walls; (Ps. 10:7) Iniquity and trouble are also in the midst of it.
Destruction is in its midst; (Ps. 10:7) Oppression and deceit do not depart from its streets.
(Ps. 41:9) For it is not an enemy who reproaches me; Then I could bear it. Nor is it one who hates me who has (Ps. 35:26; 38:16) exalted himself against me; Then I could hide from him.
But it was you, a man my equal, (2 Sam. 15:12) My companion and my acquaintance.
We took sweet counsel together, And (Ps. 42:4) walked to the house of God in the throng.
Let death seize them; Let them (Num. 16:30, 33) go down alive into hell, For wickedness is in their dwellings and among them.
As for me, I will call upon God, And the LORD shall save me.
(Dan. 6:10; Luke 18:1; Acts 3:1; 10:3, 30) Evening and morning and at noon I will pray, and cry aloud, And He shall hear my voice.
He has redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me, For (2 Chr. 32:7, 8) there were many against me.
God will hear, and afflict them, ((Deut. 33:27)) Even He who abides from of old. Selah Because they do not change, Therefore they do not fear God.
He has (Acts 12:1) put forth his hands against those who (Ps. 7:4) were at peace with him; He has broken his covenant.
(Ps. 28:3; 57:4; (Prov. 5:3, 4; 12:18)) The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, But war was in his heart; His words were softer than oil, Yet they were drawn swords.
((Ps. 37:5; Matt. 6:25-34; Luke 12:22-31; 1 Pet. 5:7)) Cast your burden on the LORD, And (Ps. 37:24) He shall sustain you; He shall never permit the righteous to be moved.
